item.title: Janet add a quote by Katie MacAlister
item.description: "I've wanted you since the moment you tried to run me over. You are unlike any woman I have met before. You are strong, and courageous, and you do not suffer fools... " -- Katie MacAlister

item.title: Janet add a quote by Charlie Schultz
item.description: "Sometimes I lie awake at night, and I ask, 'Where have I gone wrong'. Then a voice says to me, 'This is going to take more than one night." -- Charlie Schultz

item.title: Janet add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "All his life he tried to be a good person. Many times, however, he failed. For after all, he was only human. He wasn't a dog." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Janet add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Janet add a quote by Bernard Cornwell
item.description: "Life is a jest of the Gods and there is no justice. You must learn to laugh… or else you'll weep yourself to death." -- Bernard Cornwell

item.title: Janet add a quote by Helen Fielding
item.description: "It is a truth universally acknowledged that when one part of your life starts going okay, another falls spectacularly to pieces." -- Helen Fielding

item.title: Janet add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "From the very beginning— from the first moment, I may almost say— of my acquaintance with you, your manners, impressing me with the fullest belief of your arrogance, your conceit, and your selfish disdain of the feelings of others, were such as to form the groundwork of disapprobation on which succeeding events have built so immovable a dislike; and I had not known you a month before I felt that you were the last man in the world whom I could ever be prevailed on to marry." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Janet add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Mary wished to say something very sensible, but knew not how." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Janet add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There are few people whom I really love, and still fewer of whom I think well. The more I see of the world, the more am I dissatisfied with it; and every day confirms my belief of the inconsistency of all human characters, and of the little dependence that can be placed on the appearance of merit or sense." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Janet add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "Happiness is a warm puppy." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Janet add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Writing is a dog’s life, but the only one worth living." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Janet add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Janet add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Janet add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Janet add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I can live alone, if self-respect, and circumstances require me so to do. I need not sell my soul to buy bliss. I have an inward treasure born with me, which can keep me alive if all extraneous delights should be withheld, or offered only at a price I cannot afford to give." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Janet add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I am no bird; and no net ensnares me: I am a free human being with an independent will." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Janet add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "Good-night, my-" He stopped, bit his lip, and abruptly left me." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Janet add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I ask you to pass through life at my side—to be my second self, and best earthly companion." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Janet add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
Janet add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
Janet add a quote by Frederick Douglass
item.description: "I prefer to be true to myself, even at the hazard of incurring the ridicule of others, rather than to be false, and to incur my own abhorrence." -- Frederick Douglass

item.title: Janet add a quote by Donald E. Westlake
item.description: "Nobody gets everything in this life. You decide your priorities and you make your choices. I'd decided long ago that any cake I had would be eaten." -- Donald E. Westlake

item.title: Janet add a quote by Tim O'Brien
item.description: "They carried the sky. The whole atmosphere, they carried it, the humidity, the monsoons, the stink of fungus and decay, all of it, they carried gravity." -- Tim O'Brien

item.title: Janet add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "A book is really like a lover. It arranges itself in your life in a way that is beautiful." -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Janet add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "People can lose their lives in libraries. They ought to be warned." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Janet add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "When the Day of Judgment dawns and people, great and small, come marching in to receive their heavenly rewards, the Almighty will gaze upon the mere bookworms and say to Peter, “Look, these need no reward. We have nothing to give them. They have loved reading." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Janet add a quote by Patricia A. McKillip
item.description: "The odd thing about people who had many books was how they always wanted more." -- Patricia A. McKillip

item.title: Janet add a quote by Jarod Kintz
item.description: "With my last breath, I’ll exhale my love for you. I hope it’s a cold day, so you can see what you meant to me. " -- Jarod Kintz

item.title: Janet add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "Give me a man or woman who has read a thousand books and you give me an interesting companion. Give me a man or woman who has read perhaps three and you give me a very dangerous enemy indeed." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Janet add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "We live for books." -- Umberto Eco
